title: Basic Economics: Supply, Demand, and Trade

vocab.definition: The study of how people make, buy, and sell goods and services
The amount of goods or services available for people to buy
How much people want to buy a good or service
The exchange of goods and services between people or countries
A person who starts a business and takes risks to make money

teachingNotes: Use simple examples like lemonade stands or toy sales. Explain how prices change when there's more or less of something available.

sample.question: What do we call the amount of goods available for people to buy?
What do we call how much people want to buy a good?
What is the exchange of goods and services called?
Who starts a business and takes risks?
If supply is low and demand is high, what happens to price?
If supply is high and demand is low, price usually...
What do we call goods and services people want?
What do we call the total amount sellers offer?
What is money a business earns after costs?
What is the cost of making or buying a product called?

truefalse.question: If many people want something but there's not much available, the price usually goes up.
When there is a lot of supply and little demand, prices go up.
Trade is the exchange of goods and services.
An entrepreneur is someone who starts a business.
Profit is the same as cost.
If demand increases and supply stays the same, prices may rise.
A sale price often means demand is higher than supply.
Businesses set prices without thinking about supply and demand.
Trade can happen between people or countries.
Demand means how much is available to buy.

multiplechoice.question: What is a person called who starts their own business?
When supply is low and demand is high, price usually...
What do we call the exchange of goods and services?
What is the money left after costs?
What happens to price if demand falls and supply stays the same?
Which best describes demand?
choices: how much people want to buy

multiplechoice.question: Why would a store put items on sale?
What might an entrepreneur do to increase profit?
Which example shows high demand and low supply?
choices: plenty of umbrellas on a sunny day

fillintheblank.question: The amount available to buy is called ________.
How much people want to buy is ________.
Money earned after costs is called ________.
The exchange of goods and services is ________.
When demand rises and supply is low, prices usually ________.
When demand falls and supply is high, prices usually ________.
A person who starts a business is an ________.
The price at which buyers and sellers agree is the ________ price.
If a store has extra stock, it might have a ________ to increase demand.
The cost to make a product is called ________.

shortanswer.question: What happens to prices when demand increases but supply stays the same?
How can a business increase demand for a product?
Give an example of high demand and low supply.
Why do stores put items on sale?
What is profit and how is it different from revenue?
What might happen if a competing store lowers prices?
Explain how supply and demand affect lemonade stand pricing.
How can lowering production costs help profit?
Why is understanding demand useful to a business?
